required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low-dose Vaginal Misoprostol Versus Vaginal Dinoprostone Insert for Induction of Labor
clinical_study.official_title: Low-dose Vaginal Misoprostol Versus Vaginal Dinoprostone Insert for Induction of Labor Beyond 41st Week: a Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose:
To compare the efficacy and safety of low-dose protocol of vaginal misoprostol and vaginal dinoprostone insert for induction of labor in women with post-term pregnancies.
Methods:
The investigators designed a prospective, randomized, open-labeled, blinded for the end-point evaluators trial including women of at least 41 weeks of gestational age with uncomplicated singleton pregnancies and Bishop score lower than 6. Participants were randomized into dinoprostone or misoprostol groups in a 1:1 ratio. Baseline maternal data and perinatal outcomes were recorded for statistical analysis. Successful vaginal delivery within 24 hours was the primary outcome variable.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of women that achieve a vaginal delivery within 24 hours since induction process started

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of women that achieve Bishop score > 6 within 24 hours since induction process started

secondary_outcome.measure: Interval time from induction to delivery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hours passed between induction of labor until delivery within 72 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Time passed since induction of labor started until delivery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed 24 hours since induction of labor was started
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of women that require to use a second method for induction of labor after 24 hours of having started induction of labor

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Since labor induction had started until delivery had ocurred within 72 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of women that achieve vaginal delivery

arm_group.description: Group of women allocated to misoprostol induction.
Group of women allocated to dinoprostone induction.

intervention.description: To determine efficacy and safety of vaginal 'Misoprostol 25 mcg' every 4 hours with a maximum of 6 doses for induction of labor.
To determine efficacy and safety of 'Dinoprostone 10mg' vaginal insert for induction of labor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton uncomplicated pregnancy
- Nulliparity
- Live fetus
- 286 days of gestational age or above
- Abscence of contraindication for vaginal delivery
- Bishop score lower than 6
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple pregnancy
- Multiparity
- Stillbirth
- Oligohydramnios
- Suspected fetal distress
- Severe asthma
- Intolerance/allergy to prostaglandins
- Contraindication for vaginal birth

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Unit of Maternal-Fetal Medicine
